A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I'm sad that this is Carrie Fisher's last Star Wars movie. Rian Johnson kicks fandom in the face with his mishandling of the greatest Jedi in the galaxy far far away by not understanding Luke Skywalker. At times the movie seemed so silly that I thought they let Lord and Miller\, whom they fired from the Han Solo movie jump in and direct this slapstick comedy.  Don't get me started on the being able to use the Force to \"Facetime\" sort of a \"ForceFaceTime\" if you will. I felt betrayed by the whole movie. Rian Johnson threw away the good will of the Fandom with this horrible movie. I don't want to even see Nine now\, I cannot see how JJ Abrams can salvage Star Wars after this
